org.rdkit.knime.nodes

Class AdditionalHeaderInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.AdditionalHeaderInfo
  • Deprecated. 
    Deprecated and replaced by an extension point mechanism based on HeaderPropertyHandler. Helper methods as found in AdditionalHeaderInfo are now available in a slightly different form in HeaderPropertyUtils.

    @Deprecated
public final class AdditionalHeaderInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Additional header information is a set of data that is attached to a column header specification. It gives a view the opportunity to render this additional information into the header of a column. This could be for instance a molecule structure, an image, etc. The information for this class comes from the table column specification properties. The following properties are currently processed, if found:
    1. addInfoType: The type of the information defines what the information value described. A handler can be registered for a type which knows how to deal with a value of this type when it is time to render it.
    2. addInfoValue: The value of the information, which must be compatible with the specified type (and the handler that handles the type). Due to KNIME property definitions we are limited here to String values.
    3. addInfoInitHeight: Optional. The initial desired height for the additional information. This is only evaluated, if a valid value can be rendered.
    More optional information that could influence the rendering process might be added in the same style in the future.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdditionalHeaderInfo

        public AdditionalHeaderInfo(DataColumnSpec colSpec)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new additional header information object by reading the different information from the specified column header specifications. If the passed in column specification is null, or does not contain additional header information, or there is no renderer found to deal with the information, then the method isAvailable() returns false.
        Parameters:
        colSpec - Column specification. Can be null.

      • AdditionalHeaderInfo

        public AdditionalHeaderInfo(java.lang.String strType,
                            java.lang.String strValue,
                            int iInitialHeight)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new additional header info object directly using the specified values.
        Parameters:
        strType - Type of the additional information.
        strValue - Value of the additional information.
        iInitialHeight - Initial height (preferred size) for the column header. If not >= 0, it will be corrected to -1, which will use the default size.

    • Method Detail

      • removeFromColumnSpec

        public DataColumnSpec removeFromColumnSpec(DataColumnSpec spec)
        Deprecated. 
        Removes the additional header information that matches the type of this object from the specified column specification. Additional header information with a different type will not be touched.
        Parameters:
        spec - Column specification from which we will remove the additional header information.

      • writeInColumnSpec

        public DataColumnProperties writeInColumnSpec(DataColumnSpecCreator colSpecCreator)
        Deprecated. 
        Writes the additional header information of this instance into the passed in column spec creator overwriting already set properties. If there are other properties that shall be maintained, call instead writeInColumnSpec(DataColumnSpecCreator, DataColumnProperties).
        Parameters:
        colSpecCreator - The column spec creator that shall receive the additional header information. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The properties object which has been set for the column spec creator. Returning it gives the caller the chance to add other properties again.
        See Also:
        writeInColumnSpec(DataColumnSpecCreator, DataColumnProperties)

      • writeInColumnSpec

        public DataColumnProperties writeInColumnSpec(DataColumnSpecCreator colSpecCreator,
                                              DataColumnProperties propsExisting)
        Deprecated. 
        Writes the additional header information of this instance into the passed in column spec creator, adding them to already existing properties, if specified. The properties are set for the column spec creator.
        Parameters:
        colSpecCreator - The column spec creator that shall receive the additional header information. Must not be null.
        propsExisting - Optionally these existing column properties will be used as basis and the additional header information is merged in.
        Returns:
        The properties object which has been set for the column spec creator. Returning it gives the caller the chance to add other properties again.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns true, if there is additional header information available, which can be rendered.
        Returns:
        True, if this object contains valuable information. False otherwise.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the type of the additional header information.
        Returns:
        Type of information. Null, if not set.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the string value of the additional header information.
        Returns:
        Value of information. Null, if not set.

      • getInitialHeight

        public int getInitialHeight()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the initial height to be used for the additional header information. This is only a preferred height value. It will not be guaranteed that the view takes it into account.
        Returns:
        Initial height. -1, if not set.

      • prepareValue

        public java.lang.Object prepareValue()
        Deprecated. 
        Converts the string value into an object (if necessary) that the renderer of the information can handle. This method invokes a registered handler, if one is found.
        Returns:
        Object to render the additional information in a form that the renderer will understand or null, if no handler was found.

      • getRenderer

        public javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer getRenderer()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a renderer for the information, if there is a registered handler found.
        Returns:
        Renderer to render the additional information or null, if none was found, e.g. because no handler was registered.

      • createIconWrapper

        public javax.swing.Icon createIconWrapper(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                          int column,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an icon instance based on painting logic that the renderer of the additional header information (see getRenderer() provides.
        Parameters:
        table - Table subject of rendering. Must not be null.
        column - Column index in focus of rendering.
        width - Width of the space that can be filled out with the additional header information.
        height - Height of the space that can be filled out with the additional header information.
        Returns:
        Icon wrapper with capability to paint the additional header information. If no information is available or no renderer was found, it returns null.

      • registerHandler

        public static void registerHandler(AdditionalHeaderInfoHandler handler)
        Deprecated. 
        Registers the specified handler to be used for rendering additional header information in capable table views. If a handler with the same type has been registered already it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        handler - Additional header info handler to be registered. Can be null to do nothing.

      • unregisterHandler

        public static void unregisterHandler(java.lang.String type)
        Deprecated. 
        Unregisters a handler of the specified type. If no handler with the type has been registered it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        type - Additional information type of the handler that shall be unregistered. Can be null to do nothing.

      • canHandle

        public static boolean canHandle(java.lang.String type)
        Deprecated. 
        Determines, if a handler for the specified type has been registered.
        Parameters:
        type - Additional information type to check, if a handler exists.
        Returns:
        True, if a handler was found that claims to be capable to handle the specified type. False otherwise.

      • getHandler

        public static AdditionalHeaderInfoHandler getHandler(java.lang.String type)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the registered handler for the specified type or null, if none had been registered.
        Parameters:
        type - Additional information type to be processed.
        Returns:
        Handler for the specified type or null, if none had been registered.
